attributes.action: Encourage Manchester City and other councils to sell Manchester Airport to pay for transport improvements in Greater Manchester rather than impose a congestion charge for the same reason
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Manchester City and other councils wish to impose a punitive and impractical road congestion scheme to pay for improvements to the transport infrastructure in Greater Manchester at a cost of up to GB£3 billion.

Manchester Airport Group, owned by those councils, is the last remaining airport operator in the UK still in the public sector. Selling it could easily raise that amount.

High quality airport operators around the world would form a lengthy queue for such an opportunity, which, if handled well, should be of benefit to all parties including employees and the general public.
